Text.text: tbh unsure, although "daddy's private office" heheheh

Tolliver is a space pilot for the Koslow Space Station who is in hot water with his bosses. They want him to mislabel shipments to Earth for their own profit, but he refuses. He gets a mysterious assignment from a person named Betty. After a brief journey, she needs to make a call to try and bring the criminals to justice. When that call goes down it is revealed she works for
During the call,
Finally, she reveals that
. She is investigating the criminal activities of the Kowlow Space HQ.
Context: Tolliver is a pilot who got ordered to pick up Betty, who he believes is the daughter of the rich owner of the space station he and his boss, Jeffers, works at. Jeffers reaction to Betty:

After Betty tries to fire Jeffers for mismanagement, Jeffers locks away both Tolliver and Betty. The two escape to a spaceship, and there Better calls her dad's private office to report and request backup.

she is impersonating the director's daughter as a private investigator for Space Patrol. The other space patrolmen referred to her by her real name because she is not deceiving them. Judge you want evidence from the end of the story, here you go:

Also, it makes no sense that Betty is a private investigator, she only has the power to fire Jeffers and investigate the corrupt business because she is the daughter of the president of the company and has authority:

ok wait i want both of you to go back to your first arguments - someone let me know who is wrong in terms of the story you are telling me cause there are two different stories here. Betty Hanlon is a private investigator for space patrol. To infiltrate the Koslow Space HQ, she impersonates Koslow's (the station owner) daughter. Look at all the evidence B presents; it all comes BEFORE she reveals her true name and identity. Everytime she mentions her "daddy" it is part of the act. To add more context to the revealing quote

. If Koslow had a son, a man would've been assigned the infiltration job.

B leaves out all the times she stutters and struggles to keep up the act:
She even admits the cover story is absurd:

A's point/ev about a young man is completely irrevelant here - Betty is clearly a woman. 

Her father has sent his daughter to Ganymede:
Again, just because she stutters doesn't mean that she doesn't have the authority her father has granted her:

To sum up this debate - judge, I've provided you with explict evidence detailing how Betty is Koslow's daughter, while A has attempted to waste your time and derail this debate by trying to make up points about a new young man? Clear dishonest strategy to waste time - 99% vote B.

Yeah A's quotes are too damning I think that she is a private investigator as explicitly stated in their quote and further, it fits a little more that she would be calling space patrol people and not her father because the quote doesn't prove that she is calling daddys private headquarters. When she says "do you really think hed send a woman" quote I think that gits more with her being an investigator

this is super unclear; but b's ev is all before she reveals her identity. I wish i could ask more questions, but i'm going with A

answers.reason for outcome: I think it took me a bit to get to this answer, I had to re read this debate many times. But in the end I realized I was focusing too much on Debater B's framing and instead should have focused on the evidence presented by Debater A. That being said I think both teams were confused on how they were debating however, I think since they didn't have explicit quotation a lot more had to be explained by semantics on both sides which lead to me not knowing which team was right.
A used their ev well at the end, honestly i'm just glad I managed to last for 3 rounds.
The evidence is clearly in my favor.
I really was unclear, i would have loved to extedn the deabte here.
